# Description
This project contains all the assets needed to get familiar with watsonx.governance prompt evaluations.

This sample includes prompt templates for a car insurance claim processing use case. The prompts use car insurance claims as input and then use large language models to help insurance agents process the claims. One prompt summarizes claims, another prompt extracts key information such as make and model, and the last prompt generates suggestions for the insurance agent.

## Step-by-step guidance
_Note: These instructions explain how to use and evaluate the `Insurance claim summarization` prompt template. You can download this guide [here](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/watsonx.governance%20first%20steps.pdf). You can use the same steps for the other prompt templates in this sample._

### 1. Create a project
Click **Create project** to create a project that uses this sample. You can change the name of your project if you want. 

_Note: After the project is created, this same step-by-step guidance is available on the **Overview** tab in the **Readme** section._

![Create project](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/1.%20Create%20project.png "Create project")

New projects need to be associated with your service instance of _Watson Machine Learning_. On the **Manage** tab of your project, click **Services & integrations**. Click **Associate service**, choose your service instance, then click **Associate**.

![Associate WML](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/18.%20Associate%20WML.png "Associate WML")

You can now use the project to explore and evaluate the prompt templates.

### 2. Use test data to evaluate your prompt template
In the assets for the project, download the `Insurance claim summarization test data.csv` file.

![Download test CSV](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/2.%20Download%20test%20CSV.png "Download test CSV")

In the menu for the `Insurance claim summarization` prompt template, click **Evaluate**.

![Evaluate prompt template](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/3.%20Evaluate%20prompt%20template.png "Evaluate prompt template")

Select the dimensions to evaluate. Expand the dimensions to see all the metrics that your prompt template can be tested against.

_Note: The metrics depend on the task type of the prompt. For example, summarization has different metrics than classification._

![Evaluation dimension](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/4.%20Evaluation%20dimension.png "Evaluation dimension")

Click **Next** to continue. Browse to select the `Insurance claim summarization test data.csv` file that you downloaded.

![Browse file](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/5.%20Browse%20file.png "Browse file")

For each prompt variable, select the associated column from the test dataset. In this example, choose `Insurance_Claim` as the input variable and `Summary` as the reference output.

![Variable mapping](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/6.%20Variable%20mapping.png "Variable mapping")

Click **Next** to see a summary of your evaluation setup. When you are ready to start the evaluation, click **Evaluate**. The evaluation may take some time to process.

### 3. Track the prompt template in an AI use case
The results of the evaluation shows in the **Evaluate** tab. The **AI factsheet** includes the evaluation results as well, combined with all the information about your prompt template. Subsequent evaluations for the AI lifecycle are also recorded in the factsheet.

![Factsheet evaluations](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/7.%20Factsheet%20evaluations.png "Factsheet evaluations")

Now you can report the development and test process to your peers by tracking your prompt template in an _AI use case_. In the AI Factsheet tab, click **Track in AI use case**.

![Track in AI use case](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/8.%20Track%20in%20AI%20use%20case.png "Track in AI use case")

Choose or create the AI use case in which this prompt template should be tracked. If you need to create an AI use case, just give it the name `Insurance claims processing`. You can add more details later.

![Define AI use case](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/9.%20Define%20AI%20use%20case.png "Define AI use case")

Add the prompt template to an approach. An approach defines one path for solving the goal of the use case.

![Define approach](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/10.%20Define%20approach.png "Define approach")

Choose **Experimental (v0.0.1)** as the version number starting point. You can also add comments about the development process. This information is available to all stakeholders that have access to the AI use case.

![Assign version](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/11.%20Assign%20version.png "Assign version")

When you track a prompt template in an AI use case, you capture details for each phase of the lifecycle, from development to validation and then to operation/production.

![Factsheet lifecycle](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/17.%20Factsheet%20lifecycle.png "Factsheet lifecycle")

### 4. Export and import your project for validation
To move the asset into the validation step of the AI lifecycle, export the development project and import it as a new validation project. Click the **Export to Desktop** icon.

![Project download](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/12.%20Project%20download.png "Project download")

You are able to select which assets to include in your exported project. Make sure to select the `Insurance claim summarization` prompt template in the export. Once you are ready, click **Export** to download a ZIP file.

​Create a **new project from a sample or file**. Upload the ZIP file and add a meaningful name for the validation project.

![New project](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/13.%20New%20project.png "New project")

The prompt template in this validation project can be evaluated separately. The evaluation process is the same as for the development process. _Repeat step 2 of this guide._

​The AI factsheet for the asset shows you all the evaluations from the development and validation phase.

![Factsheet evaluations 2](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/14.%20Factsheet%20evaluations%202.png "Factsheet evaluations 2")

### 5. Deploy your prompt template for operation/production
In the `Insurance claim summarization` prompt template, click **Promote to space** in the asset menu to move it into the operate step of the lifecycle.

![Promote to space](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/19.%20Promote%20to%20space.png "Promote to space")

In **Target space**, choose **Create a new deployment space**.

![New space](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/20.%20New%20space.png "New space")

In **Create a deployment space**, add a name for the deployment space. Ensure **Deployment stage** is set to **Production**. In **Select services**, choose your machine learning service instance. Then, click **Create**.

![New space setup](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/21.%20New%20space%20setup.png "New space setup")

In **Promote to space**, click **Promote**. To open the new deployment space, open the global navigation, click **Deployments**, then choose your new deployment space.

![Global navigation](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/22.%20Global%20navigation.png "Global navigation")

In the **Assets** tab, click on **Deploy** from the menu for the `Insurance claim summarization` prompt template.

![Deployment](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/23.%20Deployment.png "Deployment")

Add a name for your deployment and click **Create**. Your prompt template is now going to be deployed. When you click on the `Insurance claim summarization` prompt template asset in your deployment space you will be be able to see all deployments and access the AI factsheet.

![Deployment details](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/24.%20Deployment%20details.png "Deployment details")

In the deployment, you can access options to connect your applications to this prompt template. You can also activate evaluation monitors.

_Note: It doesn't matter if you open the factsheet from the development/validation project or deployment space._

Open the AI factsheet. In the Governance section you can see all 3 phases of the AI lifecycle.

![Factsheet lifecycle 2](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/25.%20Factsheet%20lifecycle%202.png "Factsheet lifecycle 2")

Click the **View details** icon to see your assets in the lifecycle tracking of the AI use case.

![View details](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/26.%20View%20details.png "View details")

![Lifecycle tracker](https://watsonx.governance-samples.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/27.%20Lifecycle%20tracker.png "Lifecycle tracker")
